subject: Re: [junit] test cases for inputs from file
msgSnippet: ... From: Mike Clark  To:  Sent: Monday, September 09, 2002 12:34 PM Subject: Re: [junit] test cases for inputs
messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Mike Clark" <mike@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, September 09, 2002 12:34 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] test cases for inputs from file


> Jonathan Gossage wrote:
>
> >Exactly. Since Junit runs each test in an independent thread and runs the
> >setUp() and tearDown() methods in the main thread this ensres that
> >everything is synchronized and that tests do not stomp on each other.
> >
>
> You lost me there.
>
> According to the source code (TestCase.java), the setUp(), testXXX(),
> and tearDown() are all run in the same thread...
>
> public void runBare() throws Throwable {
> setUp();
> try {
> runTest();
> }
> finally {
> tearDown();
> }
> }
>
> What am I missing?
>
> Mike
>
I put thread names into all my logging statements that allow me to see which
thread issued a particular log statement. The messages from the setUp() and
tearDown() methods all were issued from the "main" thread while the messages
from the test methods were issued in "Thread xxx" threads where xxx was
different for each test method.

Regards

Jonathan Gossage

Email address jonathan@...
